website_summaries.verdict: Keep burrs and pebbles out of shoes with these easy-on gaiters that resist water.
pros: Lightweight, silicone-coated nylon fits above the ankle
Elastic top cuff provides extra support, while top closure holds gaiter in place
Stretchy instep cord slips easily into place
cons: Top cuffs can slip down slightly

customer_reviews.title: Perfect!
customer_reviews.text: This product performs exceptionally. Application includes 11.5 men's 6" boot and I am using them when I build trails, standing in brush and moving dirt with a rake or shovel, often times pulling the dirt over my boots. They do increase the temperature of the foot HOWEVER, no more cleaning out my boots, dirty toes and ruined socks. I find the drawstring applied with a knot is perfect over the other types that include a buckle or strap, no notice to the strings under my foot and they do not come undone. Getting a second pair!
customer_reviews.author: Jim

customer_reviews.title: Very happy I bought these
customer_reviews.text: I've wanted gaiters for hiking Southern California trail for years. I hate getting foxtails in my socks ! I wanted something that was high enough to cover my regular length socks and not too high to be too hot to wear or so high that the upper part is always sliding down my leg. They have a trouble-free lace on the bottom and a front hook to keep them in place. The zipper is trouble free and well made and makes putting these on fast and easy.
customer_reviews.author: frix57

customer_reviews.title: Nice Gaiters!
customer_reviews.text: These are nicely constructed, light weight gators that I use over my boots while cutting grass to keep stuff out of my boots and socks. I live in the south and mostly cut grass in shorts and boots, so I needed something to keep the grass and debris out of the tops of my boots. These gators fit around my lower leg nicely, are not too tight, and also stay around my boots during the 4-5 miles I walk trimming and cutting my lawn. They seem to be well constructed and considering what I paid for them, are a real bargain. I highly recommend them!
customer_reviews.author: Mary Reif

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for hot weather
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for hot weather when you need only the minimum coverage to do the job. Prevented sharp grass seeds and debris from getting into my shoes and fusing with my socks. My previous hike in the same terrain without gaiters resulted with socks infused with grass seeds beyond repair.
customer_reviews.author: Paul Jurczak

customer_reviews.title: Great!
customer_reviews.text: Kept the water and muck out of my hiking boots for a week of hiking through bogs in Scotland. They go on easily and securely. The only negative is that the ends of the tie (that goes under the shoe) stick out and could cause you to trip. I had to do some elaborate tucking.
customer_reviews.author: Liz

customer_reviews.title: No more junk in my boots!
customer_reviews.text: For the first time ever, I did not have junk in my hiking boots all day. I washed them in my washing machine and they held out well. Strongly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: H. Alavi

customer_reviews.title: love these things!
customer_reviews.text: Just what I wanted...I hike daily and hate stickers in my socks! this fixed that problem, and doesn't weigh me down either. will buy them again if these wear out. great item!
customer_reviews.author: chewie

customer_reviews.title: Overall these are okay
customer_reviews.text: Bought these to wear at least in summer at 7,000 in NM when on daily hikes with my dog. There are about 5 kinds of stickers this year, all of which stick to socks and pants, sometimes sliding down into my shoes or boots--ouch! Have worn these gaiters once so far. They are soft and good on very hot days. Wish they were a couple inches higher because the slick fabric does slide down a bit. Stickers did not stick to the gaiter-covered areas.
customer_reviews.author: Sogoli

customer_reviews.title: What an invention!
customer_reviews.text: I was struggling trying to save my husbands socks after using chainsaw. Everytime he would cut a tree down I would have throw out that pair of socks, because I could never get all the shavings out. Well.... these things save his socks! From wood shavings to grass clippings, and dirt.... I have been able to save money on socks with these cool things! GREAT IDEA
customer_reviews.author: Jami L. Hess

customer_reviews.title: Not robust.
customer_reviews.text: I'm not sure what the target market is. I wore them for one day (well, sort of, see below). I was in heavy and high brush and started out feeling bulletproof (chigger proof). When I took a break after a few hours I realized one had pulled off and was gone. The Velcro on the remaining gaiter was frayed and pulling off the nylon. The marketing picture is deceptive. They are shorter than expected. I'm wearing a US Size 10 men's boot in the picture. I don't recommend them for heavy use, but why else would one wear gaiters?
customer_reviews.author: Michael J. Krones

customer_reviews.title: The cord wears out very quickly
customer_reviews.text: I find these *mostly* adequate for hiking to keep the rocks and rain out of my socks. However.... The yellow cord that runs under you heal is really weak. I wore through both cords in about 10 miles of trail. I replaced it with $.80 worth of a much sturdier 4mm utility cord from REI. Seems like a huge design flaw to me, especially when they could have used better material for just a few cents more. Mind you, that $.80 I spent was RETAIL at a B&M store. Probably would have cost them an extra $0.20 per set at the production level.
customer_reviews.author: SeanTop Contributor: Watches

customer_reviews.title: kept the goatheads off my laces and socks!
customer_reviews.text: Did the trick - hiking up in the dry dry Sierras usually meant lots of time pulling out goatheads from my socks and laces. No more!
customer_reviews.author: Cindy Winslow

customer_reviews.title: Kept stones out of shoes
customer_reviews.text: Whenever I'd go hiking I'd constantly get a bunch of stones in my hiking boots as I walked. I wore these gaiters on an 11 mile hike and didn't get a single stone in my boots. They did the job 100%. Originally, I had my socks down below the top of the gaiters, which felt a little annoying around my legs, where they were slightly loose. However, after pulling my socks up and then folding them over the top of the gaiters, they felt perfectly comfortable, and I had a perfect "seal" around my leg, so that is how I'd recommend wearing them.
customer_reviews.author: heathen

customer_reviews.title: Not big enough
customer_reviews.text: I wanted to like these (to keep debris out of my hiking boots), but ended up sending them back for a refund. First, after sliding the cord lock down on the under-sole cord, the excess cord was a snag-and-trip waiting to happen, so I attached the loose end to the front top loop with a carabiner. But when I tried to actually put them on over my hiking boots, it was too much of a stretch and the Velcro would not hold. These might work over shoes or a smaller boot - if you can deal with the loose excess sole cord.
customer_reviews.author: SmokyMountainJim

customer_reviews.title: Not as durable as I would have liked...
customer_reviews.text: I bought these gaiters for a backcountry hiking trip I did last week in Newfoundland. My trip was a 5 day long hike and as you can see these gaiters did not survive. In fact they only lasted a couple hours before they were snagged on a branch and ripped. Unfortunately I was without backup gaiters and had to carry these ripped ones with me the rest of my trip. The conditions were wet, windy, and BUGGY, so it was unfortunate that these gaiters couldn't help me out. I would keep this in mind before purchasing.
customer_reviews.author: Mickey

customer_reviews.title: I thought that these gaiters were kind of small. ...
customer_reviews.text: I thought that these gaiters were kind of small. On a mid hiking boot, the gaiters barely went an inch or two above the top of my boot. My boot did stay dry in shallower water. But I was hoping that the gaiters were high enough to provide some brush protection also.
customer_reviews.author: SoCal Hiker and ProspectorTop Contributor: Hiking

customer_reviews.title: Incorrect product description
customer_reviews.text: The description says "With adjustable high density elastic cord on the top". There is no cord at the top. It is just a tight elastic band that will limit circulation on a long hike. There is zero adjustment at the top. Also, these are very and I mean very short. They only come an inch or two above your ankle. The shoes in the picture must be someone with really small feet.
customer_reviews.author: PilotBill

customer_reviews.title: Love these gaiters
customer_reviews.text: I finally used these recently on a muddy trail. I love them! I will have to get more for family members. They are intuitive to use and work effectively without a lot of bulk. Plus they look cool and don't stand out too much. Easy to pack if you are going hiking and expect it to be super muddy. Good to wear in snow, too. Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Writer

customer_reviews.title: Good investment if you don't need coverage up to your knees.
customer_reviews.text: It covered well and I even put it in the wash. Only negatives are a bit too big but, it still works well. Other thing is I am wondering how long that rope will last but, looks like it is repairable.
customer_reviews.author: ST

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy
customer_reviews.text: I have a size 9 boot, they are too small, the yellow underfoot lace keeps pulling back where it contacts the ground. It will be worn out quickly. This same lace has slack (conveniently not shown in the pictures) that dangles off the outside of the boot, begging to be caught on something that could trip you. Not worth sending back, into the trash they go!
customer_reviews.author: Kiirkes

customer_reviews.title: didn't work for me
customer_reviews.text: I have no problem with the quality, and the price was right...but these were useless for me. The fit just didn't work with my size 13 boots, because the dimensions were just wrong. They were too snug to fit around the top of my boot well, and the instep strap was placed such that it had to wrap well forward of its position on the gaiter. I actually gave them to my GF to try with her size 8 boots, and she gave up on them as well. They ended up in the bin.
customer_reviews.author: Paul Willett

customer_reviews.title: Works well, although the strings are cheap
customer_reviews.text: These work very well to keep stuff out of my hiking boots. My only complaint was the strings shredded after two uses (about 6 miles). I replaced them with a sturdier cord and it's been working great. I appreciate not having to stop several times to get things out of my shoes.
customer_reviews.author: Jessica B

customer_reviews.title: Don't waist your money.
customer_reviews.text: Too small and lightweight materials to be useful. Buy the real deal or don't bother.
customer_reviews.author: AdrienR

customer_reviews.title: No pebbles!
customer_reviews.text: I'm an avid hiker and I seem to always kick sand and pebbles into my boots. So I searched for a solution...didn't want gaiters to my knees as I live in Arizona...these gaiters come just over my boots and work perfectly. No more sand and pebbles!!! Would give 5 stars except the clip for the laces always comes loose.
customer_reviews.author: cool'n in the desert

customer_reviews.title: Worked better than expected!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased two pairs of these gaiters. My son and I were going to the desert to ride sleds on sand dunes with his Boy Scout troop. I knew getting sand in our shoes would be a huge issue. We had a great time and had a very little amount of sand getting into either of our shoes. I knew the gaiters would be good on trails for keeping out pebbles and other debris. I was extremely impressed that the gaiters kept out sand! The gaiters are well made and easy to put on. There was no restrictive binding at the ankle, but the elastic kept the gaiters tight against the leg and kept out the sand.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: The strings under your feet will wear quickly
customer_reviews.text: These are light and fast to put on and take off. There's a mystery clip on one side but it doesn't get in the way. We had strings, not a strap, under the foot and those wore away very quickly.
customer_reviews.author: John Sweeney

customer_reviews.title: Good product
customer_reviews.text: This is a good product but it is not 1 size fits all. I have small feet and I had to jerry rig them to get them to work. I was in a time crunch when I got them so had to make them work. I would not recommend if you have small feet.
customer_reviews.author: Monica Buterbaugh

customer_reviews.title: These are super flimsy
customer_reviews.text: I wasn't looking for anything grand at this price, but was still surprised by the flimsiness of the fabric. I'm not one to return stuff, so they went immediately into the trash. They wouldn't keep you dry under any circumstances.
customer_reviews.author: Margtc

customer_reviews.title: Stitching failed
customer_reviews.text: About 75 miles into a 150 mile hike the stitching failed at the Velcro attachment on one of these gaiters, rendering it useless. The rope on the other started to fray too. I did expect the fraying going over sharp rocks. So, my complaint is not there.
customer_reviews.author: Abe

customer_reviews.title: Not as tall as picture
customer_reviews.text: These Gaiters are great and work great keeping fox tails out of shoes, but they are not as tall as shown in picture. They need to be 2 or 3 inches taller to cover socks and keep fox tails out of them, then they would be a 5 star.
customer_reviews.author: Hockey Puck

customer_reviews.title: poor fit, cheap velcro
customer_reviews.text: Really wanted these to work but fit so poorly on either trek shoes or hiking boots. Velcro is useless and doesn't hold well even when it's clean. Doesn't stay up very well and eventually slides down.
customer_reviews.author: anoopster

customer_reviews.title: Great little gaiter
customer_reviews.text: This gaiter isn't fancy but works perfectly. I use it for cross country skiing and it is just what I need.
customer_reviews.author: Frank Blair

customer_reviews.title: Low gaiters
customer_reviews.text: Good for low snow fall. If you have flat sole shoes or boots these will not last long. The bottom stretch strapes goes under the sole and will fray easily.
customer_reviews.author: Ksf

customer_reviews.title: Ugh...
customer_reviews.text: Cheap price cheap material ..to low ...doesn’t stay fastened ....better off spending the more money for better ones
customer_reviews.author: Clive

customer_reviews.title: Great product, but mine was a bust!
customer_reviews.text: Unfortunately, I wanted to give it a 5 star but they ripped on my the first day I wore them. The stitching was poorly done and started to cone apart after only one use.
customer_reviews.author: GDuke

customer_reviews.title: Low quality right out of the package and very short term durability.
customer_reviews.text: Seem came apart in the first half hour of hiking and heal strap failed right after. Also, storage bag is low quality and had defects right out of the package.
customer_reviews.author: David S.

customer_reviews.title: Wasted Money. Lasted about two hours.
customer_reviews.text: it broke after a few hours of wear. didn’t last through any sludge or snow. A waste of money.
customer_reviews.author: JC Williams

customer_reviews.title: Don't waste your money
customer_reviews.text: Wore these for geologic fieldwork. Snagged on a small branch and ripped within the first two hours.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Garbage
customer_reviews.text: Garbage, broken on the 2nd day of the hike. Better to get one of these with a buckle and not string.
customer_reviews.author: Adam

customer_reviews.title: Decent for price
customer_reviews.text: The Cord that goes under the shoe tore and ripped after one trip on both shoes. I will replace it with some 550 cord the design is still good.
customer_reviews.author: cedric

customer_reviews.title: exactly what I needed
customer_reviews.text: Great for short to mid length boots. Fits fine, easy to carry in a backpack and def. keeps rocks and pebbles out of my low and mid height boots during hikes.
customer_reviews.author: William Kelley

customer_reviews.title: Nothing to fancy but I'm more or less satisfied
customer_reviews.text: It felt a bit smaller for the boots I intended to use and sometimes they will get loose which is not ideal
customer_reviews.author: That tactical picky guy

customer_reviews.title: Awkward WINOMO gaiters
customer_reviews.text: Purchased 2 sets of these gaiters. Both my sets had the same side gaiters, both were for same side foot. Its extremely awkard (impractical) to use one of them on the other foot. Design error or packaging error? Unable to use them.
customer_reviews.author: brndn1

customer_reviews.title: Nice little pants protector
customer_reviews.text: Use while playing golf in soggy conditions. Keeps the mud off my pant legs.
customer_reviews.author: gabe

customer_reviews.title: Needed for the rain
customer_reviews.text: Didn't need as it wasn't raining. Left new in hotel room on Camino along with new poncho.
customer_reviews.author: subwo

customer_reviews.title: Cheap
customer_reviews.text: Won’t stay latched to my boots. Too big and I am a 10.
customer_reviews.author: lisa brazil

customer_reviews.title: Well made and terrific materials
customer_reviews.text: I really liked the product from the standpoint of construction and component materials. I have size 14 boots, so unfortunately the one size fits all did not fit me.
customer_reviews.author: Richard N. Rusch

customer_reviews.title: Weak cords
customer_reviews.text: Very easy to fit around your boot and leg, and did keep rain and mud off pants and boots. However, after just one 4-hour hike, the yellow cords that go underneath my boots had frayed and were soon to break.
customer_reviews.author: Vance Hinch

customer_reviews.title: Chiggers bites, no more
customer_reviews.text: Bought these for my husband to use while working in the yard. Living in Kansas, we have chiggers that love to bite. These have kept him bite free, without wearing heavy boots or using bug spray.
customer_reviews.author: diane

customer_reviews.title: Game changer for my daily hikes on trails with our dogs.
customer_reviews.text: These gaiters are perfect for light hiking on trails. They keep all those pesky twigs , pebbles, and debris from getting into my hiking boots.
customer_reviews.author: Agnes

customer_reviews.title: Good product
customer_reviews.text: Good product, comes with carry bag. Not good for me, my feet are size 14 and it seems like it doesn’t fit right.
customer_reviews.author: michael lefebvre jr

customer_reviews.title: Almost worthless.
customer_reviews.text: These are so flimsy/useless that I will not even waste the time to return them.
customer_reviews.author: EG1954

customer_reviews.title: The strap that goes under the shoes snapped after one ...
customer_reviews.text: The strap that goes under the shoes snapped after one use. Did what it said it would though. Helpful.
customer_reviews.author: David Dmohowski

customer_reviews.title: Well made.
customer_reviews.text: Everything I was looking for, especially for the price. It's made of durable and waterproof material. Firstly I was afraid of too thick,while turned out I was wrong. The fabric is soft and lightweight. Easy to clean and quick-dry. It helps me enjoy my outdoor activities.
customer_reviews.author: Harley Gissingg

customer_reviews.title: Performed well
customer_reviews.text: This product was straped on and went straight up Whitney portal to the summit and back. Not a pepple made it into my light boots!
customer_reviews.author: Bobby's view

customer_reviews.title: Not one size fits all
customer_reviews.text: Not very adjustable. Does the job of keeping out debris but it’s not waterproof with the Velcro. Not adjustable to my ankle.
customer_reviews.author: Jonathan Serra

customer_reviews.title: The gaiters perform quite well and are easy on easy off
customer_reviews.text: Item as described, arrived on time in adequate packaging. The gaiters perform quite well and are easy on easy off.
customer_reviews.author: Carcar

customer_reviews.title: great small gaiters
customer_reviews.text: Bought these for my son's who wear trail runners for hiking, worked great for keeping stuff out of their socks and sneakers. Not suggested for boot wearers... they are on the short side.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Better price and works as well as the $20
customer_reviews.text: I took these on my first backpacking trip and they worked very well. Better price and works as well as the $20.00 ones.
customer_reviews.author: debbie

customer_reviews.title: These small gaiters are perfect for my needs
customer_reviews.text: I wanted these just to keep stickers and pokey weed-seeds out of my socks. They work great. Easy to put on and they do the job.
customer_reviews.author: T. Mills

customer_reviews.title: Top is NOT adjustable!
customer_reviews.text: Despite description, there is NO adjustable top strap for your ankle, just a small velcro piece.
customer_reviews.author: dvnwvt

customer_reviews.title: Working well
customer_reviews.text: I've worn them a few times and they seem fine. I did modify them to clip to a loop on the back of my boots instead of wrapping a cord under the sole.
customer_reviews.author: ux4

customer_reviews.title: Fits tight
customer_reviews.text: Never did use these. They fit too tight over my shoes. Returning was not a problem
customer_reviews.author: OneUniverse

customer_reviews.title: Good value
customer_reviews.text: The gaiters were what I needed for my hike. The bottom stirrups wore easily when I didn’t get them exactly in the right groove. But good value for the investment
customer_reviews.author: James OLeary

customer_reviews.title: Great value.
customer_reviews.text: Great product to keep stickers and dirt out of my hiking boots.
customer_reviews.author: james williams

customer_reviews.title: Multi-functional!
customer_reviews.text: Simple construction but well designed. It is an Indispensable leg gaiters for Backpacking, Hiking, Camping, Fishing and Other Outdoor Adventures!
customer_reviews.author: Gustave Longmann

customer_reviews.title: Ripped Velcro
customer_reviews.text: The Velcro on the back ripped away with the slightest pull to tighten them.
customer_reviews.author: androider

customer_reviews.title: Not good
customer_reviews.text: Toe clip did not stay put, kept coming off. Yellow cord on inside was too long, snagged on brush and I would trip on them.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Does it’s job well
customer_reviews.text: Worked great on hikes in grassy and thorny areas protected my boots and socks like advertises
customer_reviews.author: Vernon B.

customer_reviews.title: Don’t buy.
customer_reviews.text: Bunches up and doesn’t stay on your calf. Is useless.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin B. Jones

customer_reviews.title: Very easy to uae
customer_reviews.text: This is a very fine product and the price is great
customer_reviews.author: The Iliad

customer_reviews.title: Winomo adjustable outdoor ankle gaiter
customer_reviews.text: Product is functions well but overall is way too short.
customer_reviews.author: fchin3044

customer_reviews.title: Not very good!
customer_reviews.text: product did not stay on boots very well and was not effective in keeping water off my pant legs.
customer_reviews.author: Katherine Culp

customer_reviews.title: Very lightweight and pack small
customer_reviews.text: My first impression is that these is very lightweight and pack very small. The gram counters will like that. Best stay out of briars, though. Also, the under strap seems to be a bit far back, and I'm wondering if it will stay in place. Will post more as I use them.
customer_reviews.author: Jere F. Moore

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: not large enough to fit around hiking shoe and connect properly
customer_reviews.author: George Kalvass

customer_reviews.title: these work fine.
customer_reviews.text: i bought these to see if gaiters are what I need for where I play disc golf. These work fine, but are a little flimsy. I'll probably seek out a higher quality set.
customer_reviews.author: AA

customer_reviews.title: Keeps crap out of boots.
customer_reviews.text: These are just the right size for above the ankle boots. I use them with Vasque Breeze boots when I hike in shorts and they do a good job keeping debris out of the boots. My leg right above boot is 11 inches and they fit well. I expect 12 inch would be max size for good fit and much less than 10 might not close tightly. There is not a lot of leeway with the way the velcro fasteners are placed. Strings are easily replaced.
customer_reviews.author: T Mat

product_meta.title: WINOMO Adjustable Outdoor Waterproof Ankle Walking Gaiters Hiking - 1 Pair
feature_bullets: Waterproof and Anti-tearing: Durable and waterproof material prevent water, snow, rain, mud, wind, sand, mosquitoes, insects from entering into your shoes or pants.The fabric is soft and lightweight. It is comfortable when wearing them.
Convenient to Use: With adjustable high density elastic cord on the top, snap fastener hook in the bottom, can seal the area around your leg.
Comfortable: Breathable fabrics makes these high gaiters great to use even in the warmer months. The fabric is soft and lightweight. It is comfortable when wearing them.
Elaborate Design: With adjustable high density elastic cord on the top, snap fastener hook in the bottom, can seal the area around your leg.
Adjustable: HOOK&LOOP design for easier to put on and take off them. Adjustable elastic band for convenient and firmly bundling.

Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
